results.result: You are a savvy consumer. Scam artists, steer clear!
Common sense serves you well. A pushover, you are not.
Trouble looms. Learn the pitfalls or pay the price.
An easy mark! Turn off your computer, stay away from the phone, and don't answer your front door.

questions.question: When negotiating a deal for a new car, the best time to discuss the possibility of trading in your old vehicle is:

answers.answer: Right away. Get everyone on the same page.
After negotiating the price of the new car.
answers.correct: Settle on the price of the new car first, to ensure you know exactly how much a dealer is willing to pay for your old one. Or sell your old vehicle independently. Doing so usually brings a higher price.

answers.answer: Doesn't matter.

questions.question: Which of the following is a good approach when you are disappointed after buying a product or service?

answers.answer: It's OK to get angry. Let the seller know you're upset, and demand your money back.
Return to the store or website.
answers.correct: Speaking with a store employee or returning to the web site where you made a purchase resolves many consumer problems.

answers.answer: Move fast. If a transaction happened more than five days ago, you're out of luck.

questions.question: What should you NOT do when receiving a credit card bill for information you did not receive?

answers.answer: Write to the credit card issuer at the address where you send your payments.
answers.correct: Write to the credit card insurer at the address given for billing inquiries.

answers.answer: Withhold payment on the disputed amount while the matter is investigated.
When writing to a credit card issuer, do so within 60 days after the bill was mailed to you. Include copies of any sales slip or other document that supports your position.

questions.question: Which of the following is a trustworthy caller — a person to whom you safely can give personal information or send money?

answers.answer: A person who identifies themselves as a government official.
A caller whose caller ID information appears on your telephone.
Neither of the above.
answers.correct: Scammers often pretend to be someone you are inclined to trust, such as a government official, a family member or a charity. Technology makes it easy for scammers to fake caller ID information.

answers.answer: Online auction sites are safe and offer good deals.
Purchase from sources you know and trust.
answers.correct: It's your best assurance that a gift card is valid.

answers.answer: You can be certain no fees will be deducted from the card's value after you buy it.

questions.question: You want to get in shape — maybe join a gym. Before doing so…

answers.answer: Find out what happens if you need to cancel your membership.
answers.correct: It's important to know a gym's cancellation policies before signing a contract — especially a long-term one.

answers.answer: Visit the facility at a time of day when you likely would not be using it.
Don't bother asking if classes are free. They always are.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a way to improve your car's gas mileage?

answers.answer: Begin driving as soon as the engine starts. Modern engines don't need much time to warm up.
Minimize the need to brake by anticipating traffic conditions.
Use a higher octane gas than the manufacturer recommends.
answers.correct: In most cases a higher octane gas offers no benefit, and it costs more.

answers.answer: Declining to give out personal information on the phone, through the mail, or on the internet unless you've initiated the contact or know who you are dealing with.
Locking your financial records in a safe place at home, and locking your wallet or purse at work.
Shredding receipts, insurance forms, health records, checks, bank statements, charge cards, and other documents when you no longer need them.
All of the above.
answers.correct: Securing your personal information can help reduce risk of identity theft.

questions.question: What NOT to ask when considering colleges or universities:

answers.answer: What percentage of students graduate?
Did the football team have a winning record last year?
answers.correct: Ask questions that will help you assess the extent to which a school's offerings will benefit you and your future.

answers.answer: Can I transfer credit I earn at this school to other schools?
Talking to plugged-in people about your job search and career goals.
answers.correct: Networking is a great way to build relationships that might help you find an ideal position.

answers.answer: Filling out as many applications as possible and hoping someone gets back in touch with you.
Don't tell creditors you are jobless. They will show no mercy.
